title: Convert amounts into first equation
text: Let's use "s" as stocks and "b" as the bonds. The total amount of money combined is $40,000, therefore we can determine that the first equation is $$s+b=40, 000$$

title: Convert amoutn into second equation
text: Because the total amount is $$0.071(40,000)$$ and an interest rate of 8% on stocks and 3% on bonds, we can determine that the second equation is $$0.08s+0.03b=2, 840$$

title: Isolate Variable
text: Let's use the first equation to isolate $$b$$. With the equation, we can subtract a from both sides to get $$b=40, 000-s$$

title: Plug in
text: We can plug in $$b=40, 000-s$$ using the second equation to get $$0.08s+0.03(40,000-s)=2,840$$

title: Solve for a
text: We can determine that the second equation after plugging in "b" would be 0.05s+1,200=2,840. We now isolate the variable "s" and get $$0.05s=1640$$. Then, we can divide both sides by $$0.05$$ to get $$s=32, 800$$.

title: Solve for c
text: After solving for "s", we can plug that value into the first equation to get 32,800+b=40,000 which we can determine $$b$$ to be 7,200.
